mdRecord.dcterms:title: Horse teeth clacker P600080
mdRecord.dcterms:description: All the incisors are permanent and exhibit a distinct central groove on the labial surface. Canine teeth are present and show evidence of wear. These features collectively indicate that the specimen is over 5 years old. The cups on all lower incisors are absent, with no visible enamel spots, leaving only dental stars present at the center of the incisor tables. When only a rounded dental star is present in the lower central incisor is indicative of about 15-18 years old. The incisor tables are oval-shaped in the labiolingual (rostrocaudal) direction. The upper corner incisor (UCI) is taller than it is wide and displays Galvayneâ€™s groove along its length. Based on these characteristics, the estimated age of this horse is approximately 20 - 25 years.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Horses--Aging
Horses--Age determination
